parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
An olive tree; the Mount of Olives. Feminine of a presumed derivative from an obsolete primary; an olive.
Opposite, in front (of), over against. From kata and enanti; directly opposite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
From aner; manly; Andreas, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
